Class ObjectiveFunctionImpl

java.lang.Object
net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.ObjectiveFunctionImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
LossFunction, ObjectiveFunction
@Mediator @Strategy(CONCRETE) public class ObjectiveFunctionImpl extends Object implements ObjectiveFunction
The implementation of the ObjectiveFunction.

ObjectiveFunctionImpl composes together different levels of loss functions — dimension, sample, and batch — to provide a complete objective function suitable for training and optimization.

The implementation delegates responsibility as follows:

  • Uses a DimensionLossFunction to compute per-dimension error and gradients.
  • Uses a SampleLossFunction to aggregate dimension-level losses into a single sample loss.
  • Uses a BatchLossFunction to aggregate sample losses into a batch loss.

  • Constructor Details

    • ObjectiveFunctionImpl

      public ObjectiveFunctionImpl(BatchLossFunction batchLossFunction, SampleLossFunction sampleLossFunction, List<DimensionLossFunction> dimensionLossFunctions)
      Creates an ObjectiveFunctionImpl that computes losses at all levels: dimension, sample, and batch.

      This constructor links together the components needed for hierarchical loss computation:

      • BatchLossFunction: computes the total loss over a batch of samples.
      • SampleLossFunction: computes the loss for a single sample by aggregating per-dimension losses.
      • DimensionLossFunction: computes the loss for each individual output dimension.
      Parameters:
      batchLossFunction - the loss function for the batch level
      sampleLossFunction - the loss function for the sample level
      dimensionLossFunctions - the list of loss functions for each output dimension

  • Method Details

    • calculateLoss

      public float calculateLoss(List<Pair<Float[],Float[]>> batch)
      Calculates the loss for a batch of samples.

      Each sample in the batch is represented as a Pair of float[] arrays, where the left element is the estimated (predicted) values and the right element is the target (expected) values. Implementations should define how individual sample losses are aggregated into a single scalar loss for the batch.

      Specified by:
      calculateLoss in interface ObjectiveFunction
      Parameters:
      batch - a list of samples, where each sample is a pair of float[] arrays (estimated vs target)
      Returns:
      the aggregated loss value for the batch

    • calculateGradient_dJ_da

      public Float[] calculateGradient_dJ_da(int batchSize, Float[] estimated, Float[] target)
      Determines the gradients of the objective function with respect to the estimated values, for a single sample.

      Implementations should return a gradient array that corresponds in length and order to the estimated array, such that each entry can be used to update model parameters during optimization.

      Specified by:
      calculateGradient_dJ_da in interface ObjectiveFunction
      Parameters:
      batchSize - the total number of samples in the batch
      estimated - the predicted values for a sample
      target - the expected target values for the sample
      Returns:
      an array of gradients, one per dimension of the input
